div.p: Getting the chance to do training at college and things was pretty much cut off to me due to not having any GCSEs or any certificates or anything like that
so any college courses I’ve wanted to do I’ve had to fund off my own back to just try and get a basic education and you know it’s ridiculously expensive
to do it and it’s been very difficult to actually have the willpower to do that. There have been a lot of times when I’ve just wanted to sit back and go
on JSA, go on benefits just because I thought what’s the point? You know and I was having mental health problems at the time
and it was actually my step mum, Belle, who really shook me up and dragged me out of those dark places because I really didn’t think
there was any point in working, there was any point in socialising I just wanted to be on my own and she really shook me up, she was the one that got
me looking for jobs, she was the one who got me to actually write a CV and that was quite hard when you’ve had very little work experience or any education.
